newsitem.title: JAPAN: Asahi Brew shares up on Japan heat wave.
newsitem.headline: Asahi Brew shares up on Japan heat wave.

text.p: Shares of Asahi Breweries Ltd rose in active trade on Tuesday, as investors wilting under a heat wave flocked to the shares on hopes that the high summer temperatures would spur demand for beverages, brokers said.
As of 0036 GMT, the shares were up 50 yen at 1,750 in a turnover of 1.56 million, making Asahi the most heavily traded issue on the first section of the Tokyo bourse.

"Breweries and beverage-makers such as Asahi and Ito En are receiving much attention due to the heat wave," a trader at a second-tier brokerage said. "Shipments of Asahi's 'Super Dry' beer brand are said to be brisk which is also helping to increase investor interest."
Earlier, Asahi said that shipments of its mainstay Super Dry beer totalled 955,200 kilolitres in the January-June period, up 20 percent from the same period a year earlier.
